name: River Terrace Inn

reviews.text: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn after getting a deal on Hotwire, so totally blind, but had heard some good things from a friend at work, so looked forward to it. It was REALLY nice. Clean rooms, great service, nice breakfast, and quiet little location on the Napa River. Downside was not much additional dining without a little drive, but that is all. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again. Feed the geese for me!
reviews.title: Quiet Napa Resort

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at RTI in mid-January. What we hadn't been told before we arrived was that Napa had had its worst flood for 10 years on New Year's Eve, and was still cleaning up (it didn't seem to have affected the hotel).
reviews.title: After the flood...

reviews.text: RTI is quiet, modern, clean, comfortable, spacious...but certainly not a 'special occasion' hotel. We may have gained a different opinion of it in high season. As others have said, it is very well positioned for the wine train and for Napa town itself (short walks). RTI is on the river and we had a room on that side of the hotel. The outlook is pretty but not stunning. As far as Napa itself is concerned, there are some pretty good restaurants and bars in town and we liked the place - despite the river silt that was still on the sidewalks.
reviews.title: Perfect for Business or a Romantic Weekend

reviews.text: The service in RTI was very good, and all the staff were friendly and helpful. The included buffet breakfast was certainly OK, but not the best I've had in similar hotels in the US.
reviews.title: Arriving Christmas night
Comfy Bed Yummy Breakfast
reviews.text: We would use the hotel again if we stayed in Napa....but then the choice is fairly limited.

My husband and I were visiting the Napa Valley for the Memorial Day Weekend. We stayed at the RTI and had a wonderful stay! When I booked the room, I requested a room on the top floor and I was accomodated when I checked in. We stayed in a River Superior Jacuzzi room and it was huge with a nice view of the Napa River. The jacuzzi tub was great! The room was spacious and very clean. The staff was friendly and nice. Housekeeping comes around in the evening to do a turn down in addition to seeing if you need extra towels. They also offer bottled water if you need it. I thought that was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!
Loved the hotel
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was delicious with hot food (eggs/potatoes) as well as plenty of pastries (bagels and lox were my husband's favorite) and different kinds of dried fruit/cheeses/fruit. It was really nice free buffet.
The location of this hotel was good. It's close to Copia and downtown Napa. You could walk it if you really wanted to. The freeway is close as well.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Quiet Napa

reviews.text: If you've never been to Napa or Sonoma, the town of Napa is actually the furthest down in the county. Yountville and St. Helena are in the middle and Calistoga is at the top. St. Helena probably has the most wineries. Having said that, the town of Napa is very cute with some good restaurants and this hotel is lovely. It is very close to the backroad (something Trail) to the wineries and is only about 3 minutes to Rt. 29. The rooms were VERY CLEAN. I am a stickler for cleanliness and I have never felt more comfortable staying in a hotel before. The beds are like clouds. The little stream in the back is nice but nothing crazy. They have a great breakfast in the morning and a nice restaurant for dinner. The staff was very polite.
reviews.title: Great value!!

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend the River Terrace Inn. The rooms are very nice, clean, and the bed is very comfortable. I liked that the rooms did not have "thin" walls as many of the older hotels do in Napa Valley. The breakfast is included in the price and it is a great spread with a lot of choices. The staff was very friendly, but it didn't seem like they new very much about the area. This hotel was a great base for visiting wineries during the day and there a lot of great restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Although a couple of friends and I only stayed 1 night, it was great! I'm 5' tall and had to climb onto the bed to sleep...and once in it was so comfy I was asleep in minutes. Yes, we were on the first floor, and yes we had a view of the parking lot, but the continental breakfast was great and we ate out on the lanai where it was serene and peaceful. Walked about 2 blocks to the Wine Train, another great experience. Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Relaxing visit

reviews.text: We enjoyed the River Terrace Inn, mainly perhaps because we got a $119 introductory rate and it was a great value, esp for the area. We've paid about the same amount to stay at a motel near Napa.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay, With One Caveat

reviews.text: When we first pulled up I was a bit disappointed with the facade, which looked like a standard Fairfield Inn-style place (with this being Wine Country, I'd hoped for something cozier-looking).
reviews.title: We loved this place! Perfect location! Very clean and quaint!

reviews.text: The rooms were fine, peaceful, quiet. The pool was ok for my three-year-old, who didn't need anything fancy.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!
Poor service, poor front-desk attitude, great jacuzzi tub
reviews.text: The room itself was very nice, we had a big jacuzzi tub and it was fantastic.

reviews.title: Good place Especially if your going to the Wine Train
reviews.text: I would have them improve on the front-desk service. We booked a "fall special" which included a bottle of wine and a platter of cheese on arrival. It was not in our room. Furthermore, when I called to ask about it and to upgrade our room (we were willing to pay the price difference), the lady at the front desk stated that she was not the one to book our room, the assistant manager was and she was in a meeting, would be out in 5 minutes and will call us back. Needless to say, no one called us back and we had to go downstairs, even after going downstairs, she acted very unprofessionally.

reviews.title: Great time.
reviews.text: Room: nice bed, nice bathroom.

reviews.title: Nice Beds and Quiet
reviews.text: Great breakfast
This is a great place to stay if you are going to have dinner on the wine train. The station is a short walk away.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

description: A peaceful Napa river side escape. Less than an hour’s drive from San Francisco and the Bay Area, the River Terrace Inn offers an elegant Napa Valley retreat. Our casually elegant Napa Valley hotel is the perfect balance of Wine Country serenity and urban hospitality. -No-Charge Cruiser Bike Rental-Pool-Fitness Center-In-Room Spa-Cuvee Napa Restaurant
